content.p: Southeast Asian Press Alliance (SEAPA) Internship Description: SEAPA has established itself as the leading free expression advocacy and support group in Southeast Asia. It issues timely reports on free-expression violations in the region and runs a website that is a source for information and analysis on the press in the region. It supports capacity-building efforts of press organisations in Cambodia and East Timor, and independent press initiatives in Malaysia. As the first regional media organisation campaigning for genuine press freedom, it aims to help expand the boundaries of free expression in the 10-member Association of Southeast Asian Nations. As an intern, you will be working as the research and editorial assistant where you will work mainly to support the knowledge building area for SEAPA, to contribute towards research projects and information development on freedom of expression and press freedom in Southeast Asia. Terms/Allowance: Should intern is required to travel outside Bangkok or Thailand, SEAPA will bear the costs incurred. How to apply: Students is encouraged to submit their application form and CV via their respective school and you can download the internship application form here. telephone: +6 (03) 8924 8000 fax: +6 (03) 8924 8001
